author: Jeff Zillgitt
description: LeBron James won the 2016-17 J. Walter Kennedy Citizenship Award, given to the NBA player, coach or trainer who shows outstanding dedication to the community.
title: LeBron James continues to build legacy off the court

author: Jeff Zillgitt
description: At age 32, these might be the most dominant playoffs of LeBron James' career. His Cleveland Cavaliers are two wins away from another trip to the NBA Finals.
title: MVP or not, LeBron James is the best basketball player in the world

author: Brian WindhorstESPN Senior Writer
description: The Cavaliers saw their 13-game postseason win streak snapped against the Boston Celtics in one of LeBron James' worst playoff games in years.
title: Cavaliers blow 21-point lead in Game 3 as LeBron James disappears

author: Ben Cohen
description: The NBA playoffs have been rather blah but that could lead to an epic Finals if the league’s biggest stars, most notably LeBron James, come in fully rested.
title: A Rested LeBron Is a Scary LeBron

author: Dave McMenaminESPN Staff Writer
description: Led by LeBron James' 30 points, the Cavs roared to a 41-point bulge at the half as they easily handled the Celtics for the second straight game.
title: Cavaliers open up largest halftime lead in postseason history, take 2-0 series edge in Boston

description: Although LeBron James was diplomatic and said it didn't bother him that he wasn't included among the three finalists for the MVP award, the Cavaliers star later questioned the decision and lamented that he hasn't "been fourth in a long time."
title: LeBron on MVP vote snub: I know what I bring

description: Die Cleveland Cavaliers um Superstar LeBron James haben mit einem überlegenen 130:86 (72:31) ihre Führung im NBA-Halbfinale gegen die Boston Celtics ausgebaut. Clevelands 41-Punkte-Vorsprung zur Halbzeitpause war zudem Playoff-Rekord in der nordamerikanischen Basketball-Liga.
title: Basketball: NBA-Playoffs: Cleveland mit Rekord bei Sieg in Boston

author: Zach LoweESPN Senior Writer
description: Zach Lowe goes deep inside the most dangerous version of the NBA's most dangerous play: Kyrie Irving and LeBron James in a 1-3 pick-and-roll. Well, at least until Steph Curry and Kevin Durant decide to finally unleash it in Golden State.
title: Zach Lowe: How LeBron and Kyrie orchestrate the NBA's scariest play

author: TOM WITHERS
description: CLEVELAND (AP) — LeBron James' frustrating night kept going after one of the worst playoff games of his splendid career. James exchanged words with a fan late Sunday night after the Boston Celtics stormed back from a 21-point deficit in the third quarter and shocked the Cleveland Cavaliers in Game 3 of the Eastern Conference finals. As he walked down a hallway inside Quicken Loans Arena to the postgame news conference, James, who scored just 11 points and only one in the final 18 minutes, was heckled by the fan for his sub-par outing. James spun around and asked the man to repeat himself.
title: LeBron struggles, exchanges words with fan after Game 3 loss
